rules: Rule1: Should the restaurant receive a loan from the bank, then the restaurant is not profitable.
Rule2: The restaurant is popular with celebrities, or it serves meat dishes, or it serves vegetable dishes.

Rule3: Whenever the restaurant has organic certification, if it is not the case that being featured in a food show implies the restaurant is not popular with celebrities, then the restaurant gets a Michelin star.
Rule4: The restaurant has organic certification or uses local produce.

Rule5: Under the condition that the restaurant uses local produce, if it is not true that being featured in a food show leads to the restaurant not being popular with celebrities, then the restaurant gets a Michelin star.
Rule6: If the restaurant serves meat dishes, then either the meat company supplies the restaurant or the restaurant operates smoothly.
Rule7: Whenever the restaurant serves vegetable dishes, either the meat company supplies the restaurant or the restaurant operates smoothly.
Rule8: If the restaurant has a head chef, then the menu is creative.
Rule9: Under the condition that the menu is creative, the restaurant serves meat dishes or vegetable dishes.
Rule10: Should the food critic own the restaurant, then the meat company supplies the restaurant.
Rule11: Either the food critic owns the restaurant or the restaurant manager manages the restaurant.
Rule12: Whenever the restaurant receives investment from an investor group, the restaurant is not profitable.
Rule13: The restaurant receives investment from an investor group or receives a loan from the bank.
Rule14: Provided that it is not the case that the restaurant manager managing the restaurant leads to the restaurant operating smoothly, the restaurant is profitable.
facts: Fact1: The restaurant is featured in a food show.
Fact2: The restaurant has a head chef.
Fact3: It is not the case that the meat company supplies the restaurant.
Fact4: The restaurant does not get a Michelin star.
